subject   : Subject: THE WAY TO KEEP PEACE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 1 Aug 2021 16:05:29 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*A gentle answer turns away wrath, but harsh words stir *

*up trouble. *(Pro. 15:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper? It is equally hard to

argue with someone who insists on answering gently. On the

other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost always trigger

an angry response. To turn away wrath and seek peace, choose

gentle words.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me become a positive example to *

*others. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper?
It is equally hard to argue with someone who insists on answering gently. On the other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost always trigger an angry response. To turn away wrath and seek peace, choose gentle words.
original_verse_text: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but harsh words stir  up trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry, as Your Word instructs. Grant us the grace to respond with gentleness, even in the face of conflict, that we may turn away wrath and promote peace. May our words be seasoned with grace, reflecting Your love and compassion. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever tried to argue in a whisper? It is equally hard to argue with someone who insists on answering gently. On the other hand, a rising voice and harsh words almost always trigger an angry response. To turn away wrath and seek peace, choose gentle words.
subject: The Way to Keep Peace
verse_text: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but harsh words stir  up trouble.

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His eyes on both the evil*

*and the good. *(Pro. 15:3)



*Reflection:*

At times it seems like God is letting evil run rampant in the world,

and we wonder if He even notices. But God sees everything clearly

—both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying behind them.

He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in our

world. Right *NOW*, His work may be unseen and unfelt, but

don’t give up. One day He will wipe out evil and punish evil-

doers, just as He will establish the good and reward those who do

His will.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I pray for patience and that I will remain faithful *

*while waiting for that wonderful day! Amen.*
original_reflection_text: At times it seems like God is letting evil run rampant in the world, and we wonder if He even notices. But God sees everything clearly -both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying behind them. He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in our world. Right NOW , His work may be unseen and unfelt, but don’t give up. One day He will wipe out evil and punish evil doers, just as He will establish the good and reward those who do His will.
original_subject: HE IS AWARE OF ALL THINGS
original_verse_text: The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His eyes on both the evil and the good.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts that are troubled by the evil we see in this world. Yet, we are comforted by the truth that Your eyes see all, and Your understanding is beyond our comprehension. Help us to trust in Your perfect justice and unwavering love, even when the path ahead is unclear. Give us the strength to persevere, knowing that one day, You will vanquish all wickedness and reward those who walk in Your ways. We place our hope in You, the Righteous Judge. Amen.
reflection: At times, it seems like God is letting evil run rampant in the world, and we wonder if He even notices. But God sees everything clearly—both the evil actions and the evil intentions lying behind them. He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in our world. Right now, His work may be unseen and unfelt, but don't give up. One day, He will wipe out evil and punish evildoers, just as He will establish the good and reward those who do His will.

subject   : Subject: WHAT DOES YOUR APPETITE CRAVE

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*A wise person is hungry for truth, while a fool feeds on trash.*

(Pro. 15:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What we feed our mind is just as important as what we feed our

body. The kinds of books we read, the people we talk with, the

musicwe listen to, and the films we watch are all a part of our mental

diet. Be discerning because what you feed your mind influences your

total health and well-being. Thus, a strong desire to discover know-

ledge is a mark of wisdom.

*Pastor Sather*


*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will not be led by th**e world’s*

*three enemies—the world—Satan—and our own flesh. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text: What we feed our mind is just as important as what we feed our body. The kinds of books we read, the people we talk with, the musicwe listen to, and the films we watch are all a part of our mental diet. Be discerning because what you feed your mind influences your total health and well-being. Thus, a strong desire to discover know ledge is a mark of wisdom.
original_verse_text: A wise person is hungry for truth, while a fool feeds on trash.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that the desires of our minds and the meditations of our hearts are of utmost importance to You. Help us to be discerning in what we feed our minds, that we may dwell on what is true, noble, right, pure, lovely, and admirable, as Your Word instructs. Grant us a strong desire to seek knowledge and wisdom, that we may grow in understanding and glorify Your name. May our thoughts and actions be pleasing in Your sight. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*For** the poor, every day brings trouble; for the happy heart, *

*life is a continual feast. *(Pro. 15:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Our attitudes color our whole personality. We cannot always

choose what happens to us, but we can choose our attitude toward

each situation. The secret to a happy heart is filling your mind with

thoughts that are pure, and lovely, with thoughts that dwell on the

good things in life (Phil. 4:8). This was Paul’s secret as he faced

imprisonment, and it can be ours as we face the struggles of daily

living. Look at your attitudes and then examine what you allow to

enter your mind and what you choose to dwell on. You may need to

make some changes.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me focus my mind on what is good and pure, *

*I pray in Jesus’ name. **Amen. *

May we choose to dwell on the blessings that surround us, even in the midst of life's struggles, and find joy and contentment in Your presence (Proverbs 15:15). Guide us, Lord, to cultivate an attitude of gratitude and trust in Your perfect plan. Amen.

subject   : Subject: KEEPING OUR STANDARDS HIGH
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*Foolishness brings joy to those who have no sense; a sensible *

*person stays on the right path. Plans go wrong for lack of advice;*

*many counselors bring success. *(Pro. 15:21, 22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

People with tunnel vision*,* those who are locked into one way of

thinking*, *are likely to miss the right road because they have closed

their minds to any new options. We need the help of those who

can enlarge our vision and broaden our perspective. Seek out the

advice of those who know you and have a wealth of experience*.*

Build a network of advisers. Then be open to new ideas, and be

willing to weigh their suggestions carefully. Your plans will be

stronger and more likely to succeed.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to weigh carefully the advice and*

*suggestions of those who have had more experience in life. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text: People with tunnel vision, those who are locked into one way of thinking, are likely to miss the right road because they have closed their minds to any new options. We need the help of those who can enlarge our vision and broaden our perspective. Seek out the advice of those who know you and have a wealth of experience. Build a network of advisers. Then be open to new ideas, and be willing to weigh their suggestions carefully. Your plans will be stronger and more likely to succeed.
original_verse_text: Foolishness brings joy to those who have no sense; a sensible  person stays on the right path. Plans go wrong for lack of advice; many counselors bring success.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to be open to the counsel of others, to broaden our perspective and see beyond our own limited understanding. Grant us the humility to seek the advice of those who know us well and have a wealth of experience. May we be willing to weigh their suggestions carefully, that our plans may be strengthened and our path made clear. Lord, lead us not to the narrow way of tunnel vision, but to the wide road of Your perfect will. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: People with tunnel vision, those who are locked into one way of thinking, are likely to miss the right road because they have closed their minds to any new options. We need the help of those who can enlarge our vision and broaden our perspective. Seek out the advice of those who know you and have a wealth of experience. Build a network of advisers. Then be open to new ideas, and be willing to weigh their suggestions carefully. Your plans will be stronger and more likely to succeed.

*Today’s Verse:*

*The godly think before speaking; the wicked spout evil word*

*The Lord is far from the wicked, but He hears the prayers of the*

*righteous. *(Pro. 15:28, 29)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The godly weigh their answers, the wicked don’t think before

speaking because they don’t care about the effects of their words.

It is important to have something to say, but is equally important

to think about it first. Do you carefully plan your words, or do you

poor out your thoughts without concern for their impact?

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You will forgive me if I *

*have wounded any soul today by some careless words I may *

*have said in haste. **Amen.*

subject   : Subject: THE NEED OF GOD'S PARTNERSHIP
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 8 Aug 2021 16:19:28 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*We can gather our thoughts, but the Lord gives the right answer.*

(Pro. 16:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This verse can be understood to mean that the final outcome of

the plans we make is in God’s hands. *If that is so*, *why make *

*plans?* In doing God’s will, *there must be* partnership between

our efforts and God’s control. He wants us to use our minds, to

seek the advice of others, *and* to plan. Nevertheless, the results

are up to Him. Planning, then, helps us to act God’s way. As you

live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, *and then,* act on

your plan as you trust in Him.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me to always places my trust in You, so as to*

*believe that You know what is best. **Amen. *

In doing God’s will, there must be partnership between our efforts and God’s control. He wants us to use our minds, to seek the advice of others, and to plan. Nevertheless, the results are up to Him. Planning, then, helps us to act God’s way. As you live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, and then, act on your plan as you trust in Him.
original_verse_text: We can gather our thoughts, but the Lord gives the right answer.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that our plans and the outcomes of our lives are ultimately in Your hands. Help us to seek Your will as we make plans and decisions, trusting that Your guidance and control are greater than our own. May we act in partnership with You, using the wisdom and abilities You have given us, while surrendering the results to Your sovereign purposes. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: This verse can be understood to mean that the final outcome of the plans we make is in God’s hands. If that is so, why make plans? In doing God’s will, there must be partnership between our efforts and God’s control. He wants us to use our minds, to seek the advice of others, and to plan. Nevertheless, the results are up to Him. Planning, then, helps us to act God’s way. As you live for Him, ask for guidance as you plan, and then, act on your plan as you trust in Him.

subject   : Subject: MAKING A TRUTHFUL EXAMINATION
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*People may be pure in their own eyes, but the Lord examines *

*heir motives. *(Pro. 16:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

People can rationalize anything if they have no standards jud-

ging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are right*. *

*But* before putting any plan into action, ask yourself these quest-

ions: (1) Is this plan in harmony with God’s truth? (2) Will it

work under real-life conditions? (3) Is my attitude pleasing to

God*? If* you have answered these questions truthfully, your

plans will be pleasing to God!

*Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of all grace and mercy, help me to always examine *

*my thoughts and actions to see if they stand up under these *

*three questions. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
People can rationalize anything if they have no standards jud ging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are right. But before putting any plan into action, ask yourself these quest ions: (1) Is this plan in harmony with God’s truth? (2)
Will it work under real-life conditions? (3) Is my attitude pleasing to God?
If you have answered these questions truthfully, your plans will be pleasing to God!
original_verse_text: People may be pure in their own eyes, but the Lord examines  heir motives.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that our hearts are deceitful and desperately wicked. We are prone to rationalizing our actions and justifying our plans, even when they are not in harmony with Your truth. Lord, search our hearts and test our motives, that we may walk in the light of Your perfect wisdom and will. Grant us the humility to submit our thoughts and desires to Your scrutiny, that our plans may be pleasing in Your sight. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: People can rationalize anything if they have no standards judging right and wrong. We can always prove that we are right. But before putting any plan into action, ask yourself these questions: (1) Is this plan in harmony with God's truth? (2) Will it work under real-life conditions? (3) Is my attitude pleasing to God? If you have answered these questions truthfully, your plans will be pleasing to God!

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*Commit your work to the Lord, and then your plans will succeed.*

(Pro. 16:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

There are different ways to fail to commit what ever we do to the

Lord. Some people commit their work only superficially. They

say the project is being done for the Lord, but in reality they are

doing it for themselves. Others give God temporary control of

their interests, only to take control back the moment things stop

going the way they expect. *Still others* commit a task fully to the

Lord but put forward no effort themselves, and then they wonder

why they do not succeed. We must maintain a delicate balance:

trusting God as though everything depended on Him, while work-

ing as if everything depends on us. Think of a specific effort in

which you are involved right now. Have you committed it to the

Lord?

*Sather* *Pastor*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put my full trust in *

*You. **Amen.*

We must maintain a delicate balance: trusting God as though everything depended on Him, while work ing as if everything depends on us. Think of a specific effort in which you are involved right now. Have you committed it to the Lord? Sather Pastor Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put my full trust in You. Amen.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we do should be committed to Your glory. Help us to maintain the delicate balance of trusting in You completely while also putting forth our full effort. May we never fall into the traps of superficial commitment, temporary control, or passive reliance. Instead, let us work diligently, knowing that our labor in the Lord is not in vain. Guide us, Lord, as we seek to honor You in all that we do. Amen.

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord has made everything for His own purpose even *

*the wicked for punishment. *(Pro. 16:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Now this verse does not mean that God created some people

to be wicked, *but *rather that God uses even the activities of

wicked people for His purpose (read Gen. 50:20). God is

*infinite *and we are *finite*. No matter how great our intellects,

we will never be able to understand Him completely. But we

can accept by faith that His is all-powerful, all-loving, and

perfectly good. We can believe that He is not the cause of

evil (Jm. 1:13-17), and we can trust there are no loose ends

is His system of judgement. Evil is a temporary condition in

the universe. One day God will destroy it.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I look forward to the day when *

*there will be no more evil in the world. **Amen. *

Help us to have faith that even in the midst of evil and suffering, You are working all things together for the good of those who love You. May we rest in the assurance that one day, You will destroy all wickedness and restore Your perfect creation. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*The Lord despises pride; be assured that the proud will*

* be punished. Unfailing love and faithfulness cover sin;*

* evil is avoided by fear of the Lord. *(Pro. 16:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Some people have a little inner voice that sometimes whispers

“My way is best.” This has been known to be *pride*. To much

pride has a way of resisting God’s leadership and believing that

he or she are able to live without God’s help. If you find yourself wanting
to do it your way or looking down on other people, you

are being controlled by pride. Only when you eliminate pride

can God Help you, become all that He meant you to be.

*Pastor Sather*

*I pray that You will forgive me when my thoughts and actions *

*are less than pleasing to you. **Amen. *

Forgive us for the times when we have trusted in our own ways, believing that we know better than You. Help us to surrender our will to Yours, that we may walk in Your wisdom and receive the grace You so freely offer. May we always remember that our strength comes from You alone, and that true fulfillment is found in submitting to Your loving guidance. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: Some people have a little inner voice that sometimes whispers, “My way is best.” This has been known to be pride. Too much pride has a way of resisting God's leadership and believing that he or she is able to live without God's help. If you find yourself wanting to do it your way or looking down on other people, you are being controlled by pride. Only when you eliminate pride can God help you become all that He meant you to be.
subject: No Unconfined Sin Goes Without Punishment
verse_text: The Lord despises pride; be assured that the proud will be punished. Unfailing love and faithfulness cover sin; evil is avoided by fear of the Lord.

*Today’s Verse:*

*We can make our plans, but the Lord determines our*

* steps. *(Pro. 16:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The steps of the godly are directed by the Lord; eventhough

we may stumble, we will not fall. The person in whom the

Lord delights is on who follows Him, trusts in Him, and tries

to do His will. God watches over and makes firm every step

that person takes. If you would like to have God direct your

way, then seek His advise before you step out.

*Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of all grace and mercy, help me to remain *

*faithful so that I seek Your advise before I make my *

*own plans. **Amen.*

Direct our paths, steady our feet, and keep us from falling as we seek to walk in obedience to You. In Your name we pray, Amen.

subject   : Subject: HONESTY IS THE BEST POLICY
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 14 Aug 2021 15:26:15 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*The lord demands fairness in every business deal;*

*He sets the stand. *(Pro. 16:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Whether we buy or sell, make a product or offer a

service, we know what is fair and honest and what

is unfair and dishonest. Sometimes we feel pressure

to be dishonest to advance ourselves or gain more

profit. But we want to obey God, there is no middle

ground. God demands honesty in every business

transaction. No amount of rationalizing can justify

a dishonest business practice. Honesty and fairness

are not always easy, but they are what God demands.

Ask Him for discernment and courage to be consist-

ently honest and fair.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for discernment on *

*all my dealings. **Amen.*

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your guidance and wisdom in our business dealings. Help us to resist the temptation of dishonesty and to always strive for fairness and integrity, as Your Word commands in Proverbs 16:11. Grant us the discernment to recognize what is just and the courage to uphold it, even when it is difficult. May our actions and decisions glorify You and reflect Your righteous standards. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Pride goes before destruction, and haughtiness before a fall. *

(Pro. 16:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Proud people take little account of their weakness and do not

anticipate stumbling blocks. They think they are above the frailties

of common people. In this state of mind they are easily tripped up.

Ironically, proud people seldom realize that pride is their problem,
although everyone around them is well aware of it. Ask someone

you trust whether self-satisfaction has blinded you to warning signs.

He or she may help you avoid a fall.

* Pastor Sather*

*O Lord of all wisdom, please correct any problem I may have that would
draw me from Your righteous right hand. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text: Proud people take little account of their weakness and do not anticipate stumbling blocks. They think they are above the frailties of common people. In this state of mind they are easily tripped up. Ironically, proud people seldom realize that pride is their problem, although everyone around them is well aware of it. Ask someone you trust whether self-satisfaction has blinded you to warning signs. He or she may help you avoid a fall.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our human weakness and the danger of pride. Help us to see ourselves rightly, not exalting ourselves above others, but recognizing that every good gift comes from You. Grant us the wisdom to heed the warnings of those who love us, that we may not be led astray by self-satisfaction. May we walk in Your ways, leaning on Your grace, and avoiding the pitfalls of pride. Amen.

In this state of mind, they are easily tripped up. Ironically, proud people seldom realize that pride is their problem, although everyone around them is well aware of it. Ask someone you trust whether self-satisfaction has blinded you to warning signs. He or she may help you avoid a fall.

subject   : Subject: WISDOM IS THE BETTER PART OF VALOR
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*Discretion is a life-giving fountain to those who possess *

*it, but discipline is wasted on fools. *(Pro. 16:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

For centuries people sought a fountain of youth, a spring

that promised to give eternal life and vitality. It was never

found. But God’s wisdom is a life-giving fountain that can

make a person, happy, healthy, and alive forever. How?

When we live by God’s Word, He washes away the deadly

effects of sin (read Titus 3:4-8), and the hope of eternal

life with Him that gives us a joyful perspective on our

present life. The fountain of life was only a dream, but the

life-giving is a reality. *The choice is yours.* We can be

enlightened by God’s wisdom, or we can be dragged

down by the weight of our own foolishness.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, search my heart and enlighten it*

*with Your wisdom. **Amen.*

*Today’s Verse:*

*Gray hair is a crown of glory, it is received by living a *

*godly life. *(Pro. 16:31)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Hebrews believed that a long life was a sign of

God’s blessing; therefore, gray hair and old age were

good. While young people glory in their strength,

old people can rejoice in their years of experience

and practical wisdom. Gray hair is not a sign of disgrace

to be covered up; it is a crown of splendor. As you deal

with older people, treat them with respect.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, as I grow older and grayer help*

* me to live in such a way as to receive the respect *

*that elderly people deserve. **Amen. *

old people can rejoice in their years of experience

to be covered up; it is a crown of splendor.

with older people, treat them with respect.

Help us to honor and respect our elders, recognizing their crowns of splendor and the blessings they have received from You. May we learn from their experiences and treat them with the reverence and dignity they deserve. Guide us to value the elderly in our midst and to seek their counsel. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

*Today’s Verses:*

*It is more important to be patient than powerful: it is*

*better to have self-control than to conquer a city. We*

*may throw the dice, but the Lord determines how they *

*fall. *(Pro. 16:32, 33)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Self-control is superior to conquest. Success in busin-

ess, school, or home life can be ruined by a person

who loses control of his or her temper, So it is a great

personal victory to control your temper. When you

feel yourself ready to explode, remember that losing

control may cause you to forfeit what you want most.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, when I feel like I am about*

*to lose my self-control remind me to bite my tongue*

*Amen*

control may cause you to forfeit what you want most.

Help us to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry, for human anger does not produce the righteousness that You desire. Grant us the strength to control our tempers, that we may not forfeit the blessings You have in store for us. May our lives reflect the fruit of the Spirit, including self-control. In Jesus' name, Amen.

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the **Lord *

*tests the heart. *(Pro. 17:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It takes intense heat to purify gold and sliver, similarly,

it often takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be

purified through trials. God shows us what is in us and

clears out anything that gets in the way of complete trust

in Him. Peter says“These trials are only to test your faith,

to show that it is strong and pure. It is being tested as fire

tests and purifies gold—and your faith is far more precious

to God than mere gold” (I Pet.1:7). So when tough times

come your way, realize that God wants to use them to

refine your faith and purify your heart.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, when trials come my way, help me **realize that *

*You may be testing my faith. I pray **that my faith will stand *

*up **under the test. **Amen.*

It takes intense heat to purify gold and sliver, similarly, it often takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified through trials. It is being tested as fire
tests and purifies gold-and your faith is far more precious to God than mere gold” (I Peter 1:7). So when tough times come your way, realize that God wants to use them to refine your faith and purify your heart.
original_verse_text: Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord  tests the heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that just as gold and silver are refined through intense heat, so too our faith is tested and purified through the trials we face. Lord, help us to trust in Your sovereign plan, knowing that You are using these challenges to deepen our reliance on You and to remove anything that hinders our complete trust. May our faith, which is precious to You, be strengthened and made pure, so that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: It takes intense heat to purify gold and silver, similarly, it often takes the heat of trials for the Christian to be purified through trials. *Today’s Verses:*

*Wrongdoers listen to wicked talk; liars pay attention*

*to destructive words. Those who mock the poor indult*

*their Maker; those who rejoice at the misfortune of*

*others will be punished. *(Pro. 17:4, 5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Few acts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate,

but many people do this because it makes them feel good

to be better off or more successful than someone else.

Mocking the poor is mocking the God who made them.

We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those

who are different, or anyone else. When you catch your-

self putting others down just for fun, stop and think about

who created them.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me if I should ever make *

*cruel statements about those who are less fortunate than *

*I. **Amen.*

Few acts are as cruel as making fun of the less fortunate,
but many people do this because it makes them feel good
to be better off or more successful than someone else.
Mocking the poor is mocking the God who made them.
We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those
who are different, or anyone else. When you catch your self putting others down just for fun, stop and think about who created them.

Forgive us for the times we have mocked or ridiculed the less fortunate, for in doing so, we have mocked You. Help us to see the dignity and worth in every person, and to treat all with the love and compassion that You have shown us. May we be mindful that our success and blessings are not our own, but gifts from Your hand. Grant us the wisdom to lift up the weak and the courage to stand up for the marginalized. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

Mocking the poor is mocking the God who made them. We also ridicule God when we mock the weak, those who are different, or anyone else. When you catch yourself putting others down just for fun, stop and think about who created them.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Disregarding another person’s faults preserves love; *

*Telling about them separates close friends. *(Pro. 17:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What is being said here is, that we should be willing to disregard

the faults of others. Covering over offenses is necessary to any
relationship. It is tempting, especially in an argument, to bring

up all the mistakes the other person has ever made. Love, however,

keeps it’s mouth shut—difficult though that may be. Try never to

bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being

discussed. As we grow to be like Christ, we will acquire God’s ability

to forget the confessed sins of the past.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly father, help me to disregard the faults **of others, *

*for You know only too well, that I have plenty **of my own. **Amen.*

What is being said here is, that we should be willing to disregard the faults of others.

Love, however, keeps it’s mouth shut-difficult though that may be. Try never to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being discussed. As we grow to be like Christ, we will acquire God’s ability to forget the confessed sins of the past.
original_verse_text: Disregarding another person’s faults preserves love;  Telling about them separates close friends.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom found in Your Word. Help us to be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other as You have forgiven us. Grant us the grace to cover over offenses and not dwell on the faults of others. May we grow in Your likeness, quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry. We ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.

Try never to bring anything into an argument that is unrelated to the topic being discussed. As we grow to be like Christ, we will acquire God's ability to forget the confessed sins of the past.

subject   : Subject: TRUE FRIENDSHIP ---IS?
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 22 Aug 2021 15:22:31 -0500
===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*A friend is always loyal, and a brother is born to*

* help in time of need. *(Pro. 17:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The question we should ask our-selves each day IS;

“*What kind of friend am I*?” Let us not forget—there

is a vast difference between, *knowing someone* * well*,

and being *a true friend*. The greatest evidence of

genuine friendship is *loyalty*—read (I Cor. 13:7).

*Loyalty IS*: being available in times of distress or

personal struggle. *To many people*, *are* fair-weather

friends. They stick around when the friendship helps

them and leave when they are not getting anything

out of the relationship. *Let us remember our friends*

*and assess our loyalty to them*! *Let us remember to*

*be the kind of friend the Bible encourages!!!*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, If I have wounded any soul*

*today, please forgive me—and help me to restore*

*friendship. **Amen.*

friends.
They stick around when the friendship helps
them and leave when they are not getting anything
out of the relationship. Let us remember our friends
and assess our loyalty to them! Let us remember to be the kind of friend the Bible encourages!!!

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to be the kind of friend You have called us to be. Help us to love not just in word, but in deed and in truth, as Your Word instructs us. Grant us the wisdom to discern true friendship and the courage to be loyal and steadfast, even in times of distress. May we reflect Your love and compassion to those You have placed in our lives. We pray this in the name of Jesus, our greatest friend. Amen.

Help us to reflect the joy of the Lord, that we may greet others with a welcoming spirit, offer words of encouragement, and approach each task with enthusiasm. May our positive outlook on the future be a testament to Your abiding presence and the hope we have in You (Philippians 4:4-5). Fill us with Your joy, that we may be a blessing to those around us. Amen.
reflection: To be cheerful is to be ready to greet others with a welcome, a word of encouragement, an enthusiasm for the task at hand, and a positive outlook on the future. Such people are as welcome as pain-relieving medicine.
subject: Looking for Feed Back
verse_text: A cheerful heart is good medicine, BUT a broken spirit saps a person’s strength.

message_id: 17b7f37fcded1944
subject   : Subject: SILENCE IS GOLDEN
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 25 Aug 2021 16:29:41 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*A truly wise person uses few words; a person with*

*understanding is even-tempered. Even fools are*

*thought to be wise when they keep silent; when*

*they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent.*

(Pro. 17:27-28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This Proverb highlights several benefits of keeping

quiet; (1) It is the best policy if you have nothing

worthwhile to say; (2) It allows you the opportunity

to listen and learn; (3) It gives you something in

common with those who are wise. Make sure you

pause to think and to listen so when you do speak

you will have something important to say.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I confess that I need You*

*to bridle my tongue, because I often run off at*

*the mouth without thinking. **Amen.*
original_reflection_text:
This Proverb highlights several benefits of keeping
quiet;
(1) It is the best policy if you have nothing
worthwhile to say; (2) It allows you the opportunity
to listen and learn; (3) It gives you something in
common with those who are wise. Make sure you
pause to think and to listen so when you do speak
you will have something important to say.
original_verse_text: A truly wise person uses few words; a person with understanding is even-tempered. Even fools are thought to be wise when they keep silent; when they keep their mouths shut, they seem intelligent.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to walk in the wisdom of Your Word. Help us to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry, as Your servant James has instructed us. May we find the discipline to hold our tongues when we have nothing worthwhile to say, that we might learn from the wise and speak only that which is edifying. Guide us, Lord, to be people of few words, that our speech may be seasoned with grace and reflect the depth of our relationship with You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: This Proverb highlights several benefits of keeping quiet; (1) It is the best policy if you have nothing worthwhile to say; (2) It allows you the opportunity to listen and learn; (3) It gives you something in common with those who are wise. Make sure you pause to think and to listen so when you do speak you will have something important to say.
subject: Silence is Golden

original_content:
message_id: 17b84257eff6a0aa
subject   : Subject: "FOOT--IN--THE--MOUTH" DISEASE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 26 Aug 2021 15:27:35 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses*

*The mouth of fools is their ruin; their lips get *

*them into trouble. What dainty morsels rumors *

*are—but they sink deep into one’s heart.*

(Pro. 18:7-8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is hard to refuse to listen to gossip as it is to

turn down a delicious dessert. Taking just one

morsel of either one creates a taste for more.

You can resist rumors the-same-way a deter-

mined dieter resists candy—never even open

the box. If you don’t nibble on the first bite of

gossip, you can’t take the second and the third.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, help me measure carefully any so*

*called new news being spread about another *

*person, and not pass on something that is fact-*

*less. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
It is hard to refuse to listen to gossip as it is to
turn down a delicious dessert. Taking just one
morsel of either one creates a taste for more.
You can resist rumors the-same-way a deter mined dieter resists candy-never even open
the box. If you don’t nibble on the first bite of
gossip, you can’t take the second and the third.
original_verse_text: The mouth of fools is their ruin; their lips get  them into trouble. What dainty morsels rumors  are-but they sink deep into one’s heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to honor You with our words and actions. Help us to guard our tongues, that we may not be quick to speak or spread rumors that can wound others. Grant us the wisdom to resist the temptation of gossip, even when it seems alluring. May we instead use our speech to build up, encourage, and glorify Your name. Strengthen us to walk in the way of righteousness, that our lives may reflect the love and grace found in Your Word. Amen.
reflection: It is hard to refuse to listen to gossip as it is to turn down a delicious dessert. Taking just one morsel of either one creates a taste for more. You can resist rumors the same way a determined dieter resists candy—never even open the box. If you don't nibble on the first bite of gossip, you can't take the second and the third.

subject   : Subject: GOD OR WEALTH
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 27 Aug 2021 16:23:05 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*The rich think of their wealth as an impregnable*

* defense; they imagine it is a high wall of safety.*

(Pro. 18:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

To imagine their wealth is their strongest defense,

rich people are sadly mistaken. Money *cannot*

provide safety—there are to many ways for it to

lose its power. The government may cease to back

it—thieves nay steal it—inflation may rob it of all

value. *But* God *never* loses His power. He is

*always* dependable. Where do you look for security

and safety—in uncertain wealth *OR* God who is

always faithful?

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, forgive me for having looked in all*

*the wrong places for security from time to time.*

*Amen. *

and safety-in uncertain wealth OR God who is
always faithful?
original_verse_text: The rich think of their wealth as an impregnable defense; they imagine it is a high wall of safety.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our trust in earthly wealth is a futile pursuit. Help us to see that true security and safety can only be found in You, the faithful and dependable God. May we not be deceived by the false promises of material possessions, but instead, store up treasures in heaven where they cannot be stolen or destroyed. Guide us to place our hope in Your eternal kingdom, for You alone are the source of our salvation. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: To imagine their wealth is their strongest defense, rich people are sadly mistaken. Money cannot provide safety—there are too many ways for it to lose its power. The government may cease to back it—thieves may steal it—inflation may rob it of all value. But God never loses His power. He is always dependable. Where do you look for security and safety—in uncertain wealth or God who is always faithful?

subject   : Subject: WEIGH CAREFULLY ALL FACTS

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*what a shame, what a folly, to give advice before*

* listening to the facts.— Intelligent people are al-*

*ways open to new ideas. In fact they look for them.*

*Any story sounds true until someone sets the record *

*straight. *(Pro. 18:13, 15, 17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In these concise statements, *there are* three basic

principles for making sound decisions: (1) Get the

facts before answering. (2) Be open to new ideas.

(3) Make sure you hear both sides of the story be-

fore judging. *All three* principles center around

seeking additional information. This is difficult

work, but the only alternative is prejudice—judg-

ing before getting the facts.

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Lord, I know I have been guilty at times*

*of judging* *without knowing all the facts, please*

*forgive me I pray in Jesus name. **Amen.*

In these concise statements, there are three basic
principles for making sound decisions: (1) Get the
facts before answering. (2) Be open to new ideas.
(3)
Make sure you hear both sides of the story be fore judging. All three principles center around
seeking additional information. This is difficult
work, but the only alternative is prejudice-judg ing before getting the facts.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our tendency to be quick to speak and slow to listen. Forgive us for the times we have rushed to judgment without seeking the full truth. Grant us wisdom and discernment, that we may be open to new ideas and hear both sides of a story before making decisions. Help us to be diligent in gathering facts, that our words and actions may be grounded in Your truth. Guide us, Lord, to be slow to anger and quick to understand, that we may honor You in all we do. Amen.

(3) Make sure you hear both sides of the story before judging. All three principles center around seeking additional information. This is difficult work, but the only alternative is prejudice-judging before getting the facts.

*Today’s Verse:*

*A man who finds a wife finds a treasure and receives*

* favor from the Lord. *(Pro. 18:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This verse states that it is good to be married. Today’s

emphasis on individual freedom is misguided. Strong

individuals are important but so are strong marriages.

God created marriages for our enjoyment, and He pro-

nounced it good.



Amid the cares of married life—In spite of toil and

business strife—If you value you wife *Tell her so!*



There was a time you thought it bliss—To get the

favor of a kiss—A dozen now won’t come a miss—

*Tell her so!*



Do not act as if she has passed her prime—As though

to please her were a crime—If ever you loved her

now is the time to—*Tell her so*!



Never let her heart grow cold—Richer beauties will

unfold—She is worth her weight in gold—*Tell her so*!

*Pastor Sather*

*Help me to never grow inconsiderate of the gift You*

*have blest me with, I pray this all in Jesus name.*

===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*There are “friends” who destroy each other, but*

*real friends stick closer than a brother. *(Pro.18:24)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Loneliness is everywhere—many people feel cut

off and alienated from others. Being in a crowd

just makes people more aware of their isolation.

We all need friends who will stick close, listen,

care, and offer help when it is needed—in good

times and bad.

*A friend is—*

A push when you are stopped—

A guide when you are searching—

A song when you are glad—

A word when you are lonely—

A smile when you are sad—

*Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize people*

*who need a true friend and then give me the ability*

*to take on the challenge. **Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
Loneliness is everywhere-many people feel cut
off and alienated from others. Being in a crowd
just makes people more aware of their isolation.
We all need friends who will stick close, listen,
care, and offer help when it is needed-in good
times and bad. A friend is A push when you are stopped A guide when you are searching A song when you are glad A word when you are lonely A smile when you are sad
original_verse_text: There are “friends” who destroy each other, but  real friends stick closer than a brother.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of true friendship, as exemplified in the selfless love of Christ. In a world where loneliness abounds, we ask that You would bring into our lives those who will walk alongside us, offering comfort, encouragement, and a listening ear. May we, in turn, be the kind of friends who are willing to sacrifice for one another, just as You have sacrificed for us. Guide us to be the steadfast companions that Proverbs 18:24 describes. We pray this in the name of our Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Loneliness is everywhere—many people feel cut off and alienated from others. Being in a crowd just makes people more aware of their isolation. We all need friends who will stick close, listen, care, and offer help when it is needed—in good times and bad. A friend is a push when you are stopped, a guide when you are searching, a song when you are glad, a word when you are lonely, a smile when you are sad.
subject: A True Friend
verse_text: There are “friends” who destroy each other, but  real friends stick closer than a brother.

*Today’s Verse:*

*It is better to be poor and honest than to be a fool*

*and dishonest. *(Pro. 19:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

A blameless life is far more valuable than wealth,

but most people don’t act as if they believed this.

Afraid of not getting everything they want, they

will pay any price to increase their wealth—

cheating on their taxes, stealing from stores or

employers, withholding tithes, refusing to give.

But when we know and love God, we realize that

a lower standard of living—or even poverty—is

a small price to pay for personal integrity. Do your

actions show that you sacrifice your integrity to

increase your wealth? What changes do you need

to make in order to get your priorities straight*?*

* Pastor Sather*

*Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I am far *

*from perfect and never will be on this side of*

*paradise, so I pray You will continue to be *

*patient with me while we work together on*

*my * *problems. Amen*

original_verse_text: It is better to be poor and honest than to be a fool and dishonest.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that a blameless life is far more valuable than wealth. Help us to resist the temptation to compromise our integrity in pursuit of material gain. May our actions reflect a deep love for You and a commitment to living with personal integrity, even if it means a lower standard of living. Guide us, Lord, to keep our priorities straight and to seek first Your kingdom and Your righteousness. In Your name we pray, Amen.

But when we know and love God, we realize that a lower standard of living-or even poverty-is a small price to pay for personal integrity.
